title: Scroll Lock Inverted
content:
This morning, upon opening Firefox, I noticed that I could not scroll through any pages or windows. I turned off scroll lock (or so I thought), and it began scrolling. But then, in all of my other windows, scroll lock was activated. So, I hit my scroll lock button again, and now all other windows will scroll except for Firefox. Is there a setting I need to change?

It appears as if scroll lock is reversed on Firefox vs. all other apps on my computer.
creator: danieldavenport4

title: Downloading Firefox onto Mac
content: Hey guys! I work for a chiropractic office that requires a chiropractic software and it can only be downloaded through the firefox ESR web browser. I've done this many times on our older mac but we just purchased a much newer one for the office. Every time I try to download it on the new one there is just an invisible box that comes up once I open it. No way for me to use it. I've done this 6 or 7 times and it's the same outcome every time. I contacted Apple to see if it was on their end but they said to mention to Firefox support that I have the M1 chip on this computer and to ask for a link from you guys that supports that chip. The chiropractic software is very particular on what browser I can download on. Thanks for the help, guys!
creator: newlifevachiro

title: Bookmarks scrolling issue continues, "support" absent
content:
The bookmarks scrolling issue since the last update remains, and there has been zero response from support regarding it, no matter who's asked about it.

How about this - when is the next FF update expected? I'm sick and tired of wasting time using a browser that only lets you open one bookmark at a time, and expects you to scroll down through all of them each time you need to access a different one since it no longer holds its place like it did before the last update. And I'm sick and tired of wasting time reporting an issue to "support" only for it to be ignored.
creator: BigLib

title: Accidently imported sync data from chrome and need to undo it.
content:
So I accidentally imported data from Chrome, which I had forgotten was signed in on my girlfriend's account. It has imported all of her histories, saved passwords and logins (hundreds) and bookmarks.

I did not previously have firefox sync, or any form of back up (lesson learnt) of my own saved data on the browser. 

Is there any way of undoing the import without having to go through and manually delete everything?

title: Bookmarks
content:
Having a long list of bookmarks, I used to be able to scroll to the bottom, chose a bookmark there and after closing the page and opening bookmarks again, it has stayed focused around the last used one. Now, when I open bookmarks again, it has reverted back to the top and have to scroll all the way down again to the one I want. This happened since the latest update. I have not been able to find any solution in settings. Can anyone point me to a solution?

Best regards,

title: Address bar dropdown shows previously visited sites even with "never remember history"
content:
On a new tab, if I type in a single letter, the autocomplete shows previously visited sites which had not been bookmarked. On my PC desktop, It also suggests previously visited pages that were on my cell phone.

I selected "never remember history", and this "feature" won't go away. I am imagining that there must be a separate setting to turn off suggestions from separate devices, but I don't know what that is, and could someome please suggest something?

The autocomplete issue of the non-cellphone history is also a bit disturbing. If I had set "never remember history", I would expect history to never be remembered. Could someone suggest how to turn this off as well?

My current FF version is 110.0 on Windows 10.

title: No Forms & Autofill section, even after enabling it in about:config
content:

Why is this not working? What else am I missing? I'm not on a nightly build.

title: History
content:
hello suddenly my firefox History not showing. example: when i click search bar, usually the link that we always visit always showing up right ? and when we click history -> recent history showing our history right ?

and my problem is my history suddenly disapeared. i try to look up for solution and i dont get it at all. such as place sql or whatever is that.

i try to open (about:support) and found verify Integrty.

the message are like this: > Task: checkIntegrity - Unable to check places.sqlite integrity: Error: Error(s) encountered during statement execution: > Task: invalidateCaches - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: checkCoherence - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: expire - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: originFrecencyStats - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: vacuum - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: stats - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task. > Task: _refreshUI - The task queue was cleared by an error in another task.

what should i do for my history tab recover again ?? do i need to uninstall firefox and install it again ? thank you

If clearing your cache and cookies doesn't resolve the problem, try adjusting your browser's privacy settings. If your settings are on high, manually add www.google.com to your list of allowed sites. Learn more

title: DNA section as Ancestry suddenly unviewable
content: Suddenly yesterday (I believe after a Firefox update to 110.0) Ancestry.ca stopped working in the DNA section. I have turned off Mozilla VPN, cleared Cache and Cookies, rebooted several times, but it's still not viewable beyond 2nd click in DNA section. The rest of Ancestry is working fine: can search, add to trees, etc. I checked with Ancestry and they say my account is fine from their end; plus it works find on Chrome. I am a Firefox fan and hate the thought of using anything else and use Ancestry daily. Any help appreciated; Singer35
creator: singer35
